data.text: @BexualFeeling What about everyone else in the room. Bloody hell.
@ajmckenna Lord now she's on there justifying herself saying the woman did nothing wrong and she didn't want to cause a scene... 🙄

@ajmckenna The fact that she did nothing then used it for content so people could shame the other woman and give her flowers also blows my mind (also people are doing just that). Both behaviours are dangerous and shitty and smack of extreme priviledge. Sigh anyway, I know you get it.

@BexualFeeling Yes, I have to admit I was really bothered by that tweet, she got up and walked off as if that’s enough. She might not have wanted to confront the offender, but she certainly could have alerted the party organiser and protected others!
@BexualFeeling True, I had hoped Australians would act more responsible. I would’ve removed myself and kid from the party after giving a mouthful to the masked person and telling others

@BexualFeeling Same.
What she did is no better than the selfish woman who turned up knowing she was positive.

@gatcon1 Yes it is. To me it's irrelevant which country though, the behaviour you walk past is the behaviour you accept. You should see the sheer volume of people commenting on the original focusing on the woman in the mask and not the woman who did nothing about it...
@BexualFeeling Is this in Australia? Pretty disgusting if it is
@axelated And chances are if she told the organiser the woman would have been removed. I would have removed myself and my kid and told everyone else's parents regardless.
